translation: Prajñāpāramitā of the Three Sources of the Dharma Treasury Spoken by the Buddha to the Buddha's Mother

source_sentence: 波羅蜜多經卷第九
translation: Perfection of Wisdom Sutra, Volume 9

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝奉大夫試光祿卿
translation: Xitian zhuan jing sanzang朝奉大夫試光祿卿

source_sentence: 傳法大師賜紫臣施護奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial edict of the Master Zhuanfa, who bestowed a purple minister named Shi Hufeng

source_sentence: 清淨品第八之二
translation: Eighth and Second Part of the Chapter on Purity

source_sentence: 爾時，帝釋天主白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Indra the lord of the gods said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有人受持此般若波羅蜜多法門者，我當守護其人及此法門。」
translation: If someone receives and upholds this teaching of the perfection of wisdom, I will guard that person and this teaching.

source_sentence: 時，尊者須菩提謂帝釋天主言：「憍尸迦！
translation: Venerable Subhūti then addressed Indra, the lord of the gods, saying, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 汝見有法可守護耶？」
translation: Do you see any dharma that can be guarded?

source_sentence: 帝釋天主言：「不也，須菩提！」
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said, No, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 時，須菩提言：「天主！
translation: Subhūti then said, Lord of the gods!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩如所說般若波羅蜜多如理而行隨順相應者，是即名為真實守護。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva follows the principle of the prajñāpāramitā as explained and acts in accordance with it, this is called truly guarding.

source_sentence: 若時遠離般若波羅蜜多，於一切處即為人及非人伺得其便。
translation: If someone is sometimes far removed from the perfection of wisdom, they'll be able to get an advantage over people and non-people everywhere.

source_sentence: 復次，憍尸迦！
translation: Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩為欲守護般若波羅蜜多者，當如守護虛空，是為行般若波羅蜜多。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva wants to guard the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, he's like guarding space, which is called practicing the perfection of prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 於汝意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 彼呼聲響能守護耶？」
translation: Can they guard the sound of their call?

source_sentence: 帝釋天主言：「尊者須菩提！
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said, Venerable Subhūti!

source_sentence: 彼呼聲響不能守護。」
translation: The sound of their call can't be guarded.

source_sentence: 須菩提言：「如是，如是！
translation: Suppository said, So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 當知一切法如呼聲響。
translation: You should know that all dharmas are like the sound of a call.

source_sentence: 若如是知，即於諸法無所觀、無所示、無所生、無所得。
translation: If someone thus knows, that is, they don't contemplate things, don't show them, don't produce anything, and don't attain anything.

source_sentence: 是為菩薩摩訶薩行般若波羅蜜多。」
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva's practice of the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 爾時，三千大千世界一一界中，從四大王天乃至大梵王天，彼彼所有娑婆界主大梵天王、帝釋天主并餘天子，
translation: At the time, in each of the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds, from the four great king gods up to the great Brahmā king gods, there were Mahābrahmā, Indra, and all the other celestial beings in

source_sentence: 以佛威神加持力故，即時各各來詣佛所，頭面著地禮世尊足，右繞三匝退住一面。
translation: Because of the Buddha's authoritative power, they each immediately came to the Buddha, bowed their heads and feet at his feet, circumambulated him three times to his right, withdrew, and stood to one side.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊以威神力，令彼一切梵王、帝釋及諸梵眾，并餘四天王天諸天子等，
translation: At that time the World-honored One, through his supernatural powers, caused all the Brahmā kings, Indra, the gods of Rūpadhātu and Brahmakāyika, as well as the other four heavenly kings and celestial being

source_sentence: 各各得見千佛世尊，於諸方處一一如應宣說般若波羅蜜多法門，如是名句文皆同一說相，
translation: Each of them had seen a thousand buddhas, the world-honored ones, in each direction one by one expounding the teachings of prajñāpāramitā as they should be taught, and such names, phrases, and syllables all spoken

source_sentence: 所有般若波羅蜜多法門品類章句皆悉無異，彼受法者皆名須菩提，其請問者亦如帝釋天主。
translation: All the chapters and sections of the Prajñāpāramitā-dharma school are all the same, and those who receive the teaching are all called Subhūti, whose questioner is like Indra, the lord of gods.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告彼諸梵王、帝釋天主等言：「汝等於此地方今見諸佛如是宣說般若波羅蜜多法門，
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed those Brahmas, Indras, gods, and so forth, saying, You see the buddhas here now explaining the teaching of the perfection of wisdom in this way.

source_sentence: 所有慈氏菩薩摩訶薩，當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果已，於此地方亦復如是宣說般若波羅蜜多法門。」
translation: All the Maitreya bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas who will attain the fruit of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment will also thus explain the teaching of the prajñāpāramitā dharma-gate in this place.

source_sentence: 歎勝品第九
translation: The ninth chapter of the exclamation of praise

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者須菩提白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Venerable Subhūti said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜多甚深微妙，於其名中畢竟不可得，非彼語言而能宣說，如般若波羅蜜多名不可得故，
translation: The prajñāpāramitā is so profound and subtle that it's ultimately ungraspable in terms of its name, but it can't be explained by words, just as the many names of the prajñāpāramitā are un

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜多法亦不可得。
translation: The prajñāpāramitā teachings are also unobtainable.

source_sentence: 而此般若波羅蜜多，名字及法無二差別，皆無所生、俱不可得。
translation: The names and dharmas of these prajñāpāramitā are not two, and there's no distinction between them, neither arising nor attainable.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如佛所言，慈氏菩薩摩訶薩當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果已，於此地方亦復如是宣說般若波羅蜜多者，
translation: Just as the Buddha said, “O Maitreya, once the bodhisattva Mahāsattva Maitreya has accomplished the fruit of highest, complete enlightenment, he teaches the perfection of wisdom in this very place.

source_sentence: 此法甚深，彼云何說？」
translation: This teaching is so profound, how did they explain it?

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告尊者須菩提言：「彼慈氏菩薩摩訶薩當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果已，
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Venerable Subhūti, saying: That bodhisattva Maitreya will attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 於此地方說般若波羅蜜多時，不說色若常若無常、若解若縛，不說受、想、行、識若常若無常、若解若縛。
translation: When the perfection of wisdom is taught here, it's not explained that form is permanent or impermanent, liberated or bound, and it's not explained that feeling, perception, volition, or consciousness are permanent or impermanent, liberated

source_sentence: 說色、受、想、行、識畢竟清淨。
translation: They say form, feeling, perception, perception, volition, and consciousness are ultimately pure.

source_sentence: 須菩提！
translation: Subhūti!

source_sentence: 彼菩薩以如是名句文，如實宣說般若波羅蜜多。」
translation: That bodhisattva uses such names, phrases, and words to truly proclaim the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 爾時，須菩提白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Subhūti said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜多清淨。」
translation: The prajñāpāramitā is pure.

source_sentence: 佛言：「須菩提！
translation: The Buddha said, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 色清淨故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translation: Because form is purified, the prajñāpāramitā is purified.

source_sentence: 受、想、行、識清淨故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translation: Because feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are purified, the prajñāpāramitā is purified.

source_sentence: 色不生不滅、不著煩惱、不出世間故清淨，般若波羅蜜多亦如是清淨。
translation: Form that doesn't arise, doesn't cease, doesn't cling to afflictions, and doesn't transcend the world is therefore pure, and so is the prajñāpāramitā pure.

source_sentence: 受、想、行、識不生不滅、不著煩惱、不出世間故清淨，般若波羅蜜多亦如是清淨。
translation: Because feeling, perception, volition, volition, and consciousness don't arise or cease, aren't attached to afflictions, and aren't pure because they don't transcend the world, the prajñāpāramitā is

source_sentence: 色無染故，般若波羅蜜多清淨，受、想、行、識無染故，般若波羅蜜多清淨；
translation: Because form is without defilement, the perfection of wisdom is pure; because feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are without defilement, the perfection of wisdom is pure.

source_sentence: 一切法無染故，般若波羅蜜多清淨；
translation: Because all things are without defilement, the transcendent wisdom of liberation is pure.

source_sentence: 虛空清淨故，般若波羅蜜多清淨；
translation: Because space is purified, the transcendent wisdom-pāramitā is purified.

source_sentence: 一切法如虛空、如聲響故清淨，般若波羅蜜多亦如是清淨。」
translation: All dharmas are pure because they are like space and sound, and so is the prajñāpāramitā pure.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者須菩提白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Venerable Subhūti said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有善男子、善女人，於此般若波羅蜜多法門發清淨心，聽受讀誦、為人演說，
translation: “Furthermore, if there are sons and daughters of a virtuous family who give rise to pure aspirations regarding this teaching of the transcendent wisdom they will hear, accept, recite, and teach it for others.

source_sentence: 當知是人得大善利，眼、耳、鼻、舌、身根清淨，離諸病苦，一切惡毒不能傷害，
translation: You should know that these people will attain great benefits. Their eyes, ears, nose, tongue, and body faculties will be purified, free of all illnesses and pains, and they won’t be harmed by any bad poison

source_sentence: 壽命增長無中夭難。
translation: Their life span increases without the difficulty of not dying in the interim.

source_sentence: 常得千天子眾或時導前或時從後，於一切處密為守護。
translation: He always had a multitude of one thousand celestial beings, sometimes leading and sometimes following him, who guarded him secretly in all places.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 諸持法者善男子、善女人，應於白月八日、十四日、十五日，清淨身語心業，
translation: Good men and good women who preserve the Dharma should purify their bodily, verbal, and mental actions on the eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth days of the white moon.

source_sentence: 於諸方處讀誦此般若波羅蜜多法門，或為他人解說其義。
translation: Recite this prajñāpāramitā teaching in various places, or explain its meaning for others.

source_sentence: 當知是善男子、善女人得福甚多。」
translation: You should know that these are good men and good women who attain great merit.

source_sentence: 佛告須菩提言：「如是，如是！
translation: The Buddha told Subhūti, So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 如汝所說。
translation: It's as you say.

source_sentence: 若有善男子、善女人，於一切處讀誦解說此般若波羅蜜多法門時，常有千天子眾往彼持法人所，
translation: “Furthermore, if there are sons and daughters of a virtuous family who go everywhere to recite this teaching of the perfection of wisdom, one thousand celestial beings will always be present at that spiritual benefactor’s place.

source_sentence: 為欲聽受正法大利益故密護其人。
translation: They want to hear and receive the great benefits of the right teaching, so they secretly protect them.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 此般若波羅蜜多法門，於天上人間為最勝寶。
translation: This prajñāpāramitā dharma-gate is the most excellent treasure among gods and humans.

source_sentence: 以是緣故，善男子、善女人能受持者，得福甚多。
translation: Because of these reasons, good men and good women who are able to receive and uphold it will attain great merit.

source_sentence: 「復次，須菩提！
translation: Furthermore, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 若有受持讀誦解說此甚深般若波羅蜜多法門者，於現世中得大善利，獲最勝寶，
translation: If there is anyone who retains, recites, understands, and teaches this profound teaching of the perfection of wisdom, they’ll attain great good rewards in the present life and attain the most excellent treasure.

source_sentence: 天上人間共所尊重。
translation: They're respected by gods and humans alike.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 此般若波羅蜜多法門，能與眾生廣大利樂。
translation: This prajñāpāramitā dharma-gate of wisdom can give great benefits and happiness to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 須菩提！
translation: Subhūti!

source_sentence: 彼一切法，不生不滅、不染不淨、無取無捨，無所有、無所得，般若波羅蜜多亦不生不滅、不染不淨、無取無捨，
translation: All those things that don't arise and don't cease, are neither defiled nor pure, have no grasping or equanimity, have nothing to possess and nothing to attain, and the prajñāpāramitā also doesn'

source_sentence: 無所有、無所得。
translation: Nothing exists and nothing is attained.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 色無染故，般若波羅蜜多亦無染，受、想、行、識無染故，般若波羅蜜多亦無染。
translation: Because form is undefiled, the prajñāpāramitā is also undefiled, and because feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are undefiled, the prajñāpāramitā is also undefiled.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩若於諸法不生分別，是為行般若波羅蜜多。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva doesn't discriminate among dharmas, this is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā practice.

source_sentence: 須菩提！
translation: Subhūti!

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜多，非內非外、不出不入，無法可示、無法可觀。」
translation: The prajñāpāramitā is neither internal nor external, neither external nor internal, and there's nothing to show or contemplate.

source_sentence: 爾時，三千大千世界所來集會一切梵王、帝釋及諸天子，各各踊躍歡喜，
translation: At that time, all the Brahmas, Indras, and other celestial beings who had come from a great manifold cosmos of one thousand worlds were assembled.

source_sentence: 咸作是言：「我等今日於閻浮提中，得聞世尊第二轉此甚深般若波羅蜜多法輪。
translation: They all said, Today, we've heard the Bhagavān turn this profound prajñāpāramitā wheel of the Dharma wheel for the second time in Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 彼當來世，慈氏菩薩成正覺已轉此法輪時，願我亦復得聞此法。」
translation: In a future life, when Maitreya Bodhisattva becomes perfectly enlightened and turns this wheel of the Dharma, may I also hear this teaching.

source_sentence: 佛告須菩提言：「法非初轉、非第二轉，當知諸法畢竟無所有而不可轉。
translation: The Buddha told Subhūti, You should know that things are ultimately without existence and can't be turned.

source_sentence: 須菩提！
translation: Subhūti!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩修學般若波羅蜜多亦復如是。」
translation: So it is with the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who cultivates the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者須菩提白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Venerable Subhūti said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 大波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，所以者何？
translation: The great perfection is the perfection of wisdom, and why is it so?

source_sentence: 彼一切法離諸著故。
translation: It's because all those things are free of attachment.

source_sentence: 而諸菩薩摩訶薩修一切法，乃至證得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果，亦無法可證。
translation: The bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, cultivate all dharmas up to the point where they realize the fruit of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, but there's no way to realize it.

source_sentence: 雖轉法輪，亦無法可示、無法可得。
translation: Even though they turn the wheel of the Dharma, there's nothing to show and nothing to attain.

source_sentence: 以無證、無示、無所得故，一切法空，畢竟離著。
translation: Because there's no realization, no indication, and no attainment, the emptiness of all dharmas is ultimately free of attachment.

source_sentence: 由離著故，即一切法無還無轉。
translation: Because they are free of attachment, all things have no return and no turning.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 一切法離性，是故無還無轉。」
translation: All dharmas are free of nature, so there's no return and no turning.

source_sentence: 佛告尊者須菩提言：「如是，如是！
translation: The Buddha told Venerable Subhūti, So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 如汝所說，須菩提！
translation: As you say, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 彼空解脫門無還無轉，無相、無願解脫門亦無還無轉。
translation: The liberation gate of emptiness has no return and no turning, and the liberation gates of signlessness and wishlessness also have no return and no turning.

source_sentence: 須菩提！
translation: Subhūti!

source_sentence: 雖於諸法如是宣說，而諸法性畢竟寂滅，無說、無示、無聞、無得，無法可證。
translation: Although they thus explain all dharmas, the nature of dharmas ultimately ceases, and there's nothing to teach, nothing to show, nothing to hear, nothing to attain, and nothing to realize.

source_sentence: 以無所證故，亦無證者。
translation: Because there's nothing to realize, there's no realization either.

source_sentence: 是故諸法無滅無非滅。」
translation: Therefore, all dharmas lack cessation and are neither cessation nor non-cessation.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者須菩提白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Venerable Subhūti said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 無邊波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，虛空無邊故。
translation: The perfection of limitlessness is the perfection of wisdom, because space has no limit.

source_sentence: 無等等波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，一切法不可得故。
translation: The peerless perfection of wisdom is the perfection of prajñā, because all dharmas are unobtainable.

source_sentence: 離波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，畢竟空故。
translation: The perfection of freedom is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, which is ultimately empty.

source_sentence: 不可破波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，一切法性不可得故。
translation: The irrefutable perfection of wisdom is the perfection of prajñā, because all dharmas are ungraspable in their nature.

source_sentence: 無句波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法無名無相故。
translation: The prajñāpāramitā of the absence of words is the prajñāpāramitā, because all dharmas lack names and marks.

source_sentence: 無性波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法無來故。
translation: The prajñāpāramitā of the absence of nature is the prajñāpāramitā, because all dharmas lack coming.

source_sentence: 無言波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法無分別故。
translation: The prajñāpāramitā without words is the prajñāpāramitā, because there's no discrimination of dharmas.

source_sentence: 無來波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸蘊不可得故。
translation: The unsurpassed perfection of wisdom is the perfection of prajñā, because the aggregates are unobtainable.

source_sentence: 無去波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法無來故。
translation: The perfection of no going is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, because all dharmas have no coming.

source_sentence: 無集波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法無取故。
translation: The absence of the perfection of accumulation is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, because all dharmas lack grasping.

source_sentence: 無盡波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法無盡相故。
translation: The inexhaustible perfection is the perfection of wisdom, because all dharmas have inexhaustible characteristics.

source_sentence: 無生波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法無著故。
translation: The perfection of nonarising is the perfection of prajñā, because all dharmas lack attachment.

source_sentence: 無作波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，作者不可得故。
translation: The unconstructed perfection of wisdom is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, because its author is unobtainable.

source_sentence: 無知者波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法無主宰故。
translation: The perfection of the ignorant is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, because all dharmas lack a master.

source_sentence: 無所至波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，無退沒故。
translation: The perfection of nothingness is the perfection of prajñā, because there's no retrogression.

source_sentence: 不滅波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，前後中際不可得故。
translation: The perfection of not ceasing is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because it's unobtainable at the front, back, middle, and end.

source_sentence: 夢幻、影響、陽焰等波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法不生故。
translation: The perfections of illusion, influence, miraculous flame, and so forth are the perfections of prajñāpāramitā because all dharmas don't arise.

source_sentence: 無煩惱波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，貪瞋癡等性清淨故。
translation: The perfection of the absence of afflictions is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because the natures of greed, anger, delusion, and so forth are pure.

source_sentence: 無出世波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，所依止不可得故。
translation: The absence of supramundane perfections is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, because what they rely on is unobtainable.

source_sentence: 無染污波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，虛空清淨故。
translation: The perfection of being undefiled is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because space is pure.

source_sentence: 無戲論波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法平等故。
translation: The perfection of no conceptual elaborations is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because all dharmas are equal.

source_sentence: 無念波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸念不生故。
translation: The perfection of no-thought is the perfection of prajñā, because thoughts don't arise.

source_sentence: 無動波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法性常住故。
translation: The perfection of immovability is the perfection of wisdom, because the natures of dharmas are always abiding.

source_sentence: 離欲波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法性真實故。
translation: The perfection of freedom from desire is the perfection of prajñā, because the natures of dharmas are real.

source_sentence: 無起波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法無疑故。
translation: The perfection of nonarising is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, because all dharmas lack doubt.

source_sentence: 寂靜波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法相不可得故。
translation: The perfection of quiescence is the perfection of prajñā, because the characteristics of dharmas are unobtainable.

source_sentence: 無過失波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，具足諸功德故。
translation: The perfection of faultlessness is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, which is replete with merits.

source_sentence: 無眾生波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，眾生際不可得故。
translation: The absence of the perfection of sentient beings is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because the limits of sentient beings are unobtainable.

source_sentence: 無斷波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法不起故。
translation: The perfection of non-abandonment is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because all dharmas don't arise.

source_sentence: 無二邊波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法離著故。
translation: The perfection of nonduality is the perfection of prajñā, because all dharmas are free of attachment.

source_sentence: 無異波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，諸法無和合故。
translation: The perfection of nondifference is the perfection of prajñā, because there's no conjunction of dharmas.

source_sentence: 無著波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，不分別聲聞、緣覺地故。
translation: The perfection of nonattachment is the perfection of wisdom because it doesn't discriminate between the stages of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 不分別波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，分別平等故。
translation: The perfection of not discriminating is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because it discriminates equality.

source_sentence: 無量波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，量法平等故。
translation: The immeasurable perfection of wisdom is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because it's equal in terms of measurement and dharmas.

source_sentence: 如虛空波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，一切法無障礙故。
translation: Just as the perfection of space is the perfection of wisdom, it's because all dharmas are unobstructed.

source_sentence: 無常波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，一切法有為故。
translation: The perfection of impermanence is the perfection of prajñā, because all things are conditioned.

source_sentence: 苦波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，虛空平等故。
translation: The perfection of suffering is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because space is equal.

source_sentence: 空波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，一切法不可得故。
translation: The perfection of emptiness is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, because all dharmas are unobtainable.

source_sentence: 無我波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，我不可得故。
translation: The perfection of selflessness is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, because self is unobtainable.

source_sentence: 無相波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，一切法不可轉故。
translation: The signless perfection is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because all dharmas can't be transformed.

source_sentence: 空性波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，畢竟無邊故。
translation: The perfection of emptiness is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because it's ultimately limitless.

source_sentence: 念處、正懃、神足、根、力、覺、道波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，三十七菩提分法不可得故。
translation: The perfection of mindfulness, correctness, miraculous abilities, faculties, powers, enlightenment, and the perfection of the path are the perfections of prajñāpāramitā because the thirty-seven factors of enlighten

source_sentence: 空、無相、無願波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，三解脫門不可得故。
translation: The perfections of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are the perfections of prajñāpāramitā because the three gates of liberation are unobtainable.

source_sentence: 內有色觀外色等波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，八解脫不可得故。
translation: The perfection of observing external forms with internal forms and so forth is the perfection of prajñā, because the eight liberations are unobtainable.

source_sentence: 初禪定等波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，九先行法不可得故。
translation: The perfections of the first dhyāna and so forth are the perfections of prajñā, because the nine preceding dharmas are unobtainable.

source_sentence: 苦、集、滅、道波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，四聖諦法不可得故。
translation: The perfections of suffering, arising, cessation, and the path are the perfections of prajñāpāramitā because the dharmas of the four noble truths are unobtainable.

source_sentence: 布施等波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，十波羅蜜多不可得故。
translation: The perfections of generosity and so forth are the perfections of prajñāpāramitā, because the ten perfections are unobtainable.

source_sentence: 十力波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，不可破壞故。
translation: The perfection of the ten powers is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because it can't be broken.

source_sentence: 四無所畏波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，不怯不懼不退不沒故。
translation: The four perfections of fearlessness are the perfections of prajñāpāramitā because they aren't frightened, don't fear, don't regress, and don't disappear.

source_sentence: 離繫波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，一切智智無著無礙故。
translation: The perfection of freedom from fetters is the perfection of prajñā, because omniscience and cognition are unattached and unobstructed.

source_sentence: 如來無量功德波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，過諸數法故。
translation: The Tathāgata's immeasurable merit-pāramitā is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, which goes beyond the number of dharmas.

source_sentence: 如來真如波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，一切法真如平等故。
translation: The perfection of the Tathāgata's true nature is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because all dharmas are truly equal.

source_sentence: 自然智波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，一切法自性平等故。
translation: The perfection of natural knowledge is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā because all dharmas are equal in their own nature.

source_sentence: 一切智智波羅蜜多是般若波羅蜜多，一切法性一切法相，不可得不可知故。」
translation: The perfection of omniscience and knowledge is the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, which is the nature of all dharmas and all their characteristics that are ungraspable and unknowable.

source_sentence: 讚持品第十之一
translation: Eleventh Chapter of Praise and Maintenance

source_sentence: 爾時，帝釋天主作是念：「諸善男子、善女人，若得暫聞此般若波羅蜜多法門者，
translation: It was then that the lord of Indra thought, Good men and good women, if you were to hear this teaching of the perfection of wisdom for a moment,

source_sentence: 是人於諸佛所已種善根，何況有人於此般若波羅蜜多法門，能受持讀誦、記念思惟，
translation: That person has planted roots of goodness with the buddhas, so why wouldn’t someone accept, retain, recite, and remember this teaching of prajñāpāramitā?

source_sentence: 為人演說，如所說學、如所說行、如理相應。
translation: He explains it for others, training as explained, practice as explained, and principle as associated with it.

source_sentence: 是人已於無量無數佛世尊所，恭敬供養種諸善根。
translation: That person has venerated and offered support to measureless and countless buddhas and world-honored ones, planting good roots.

source_sentence: 又若有人，聞此般若波羅蜜多法門，不驚不怖不退不沒者，是人久於過去如來、應供、正等正覺所，
translation: Furthermore, if someone hears this teaching of the perfection of wisdom and doesn’t fear it, don’t retreat from it, and don’t fall into it—that person has long been in the presence of the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfect

source_sentence: 已曾聽受此甚深法請問其義，於是法中如理修習，是故今聞不生驚怖，
translation: Having heard this profound teaching and asked its meaning, they correctly practice it. Therefore, having heard it now, they are not frightened or terrified.

source_sentence: 如所說學、如所說行、如理相應。」
translation: It's associated with training as explained, practice as explained, and principle as explained.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者舍利子知帝釋天主心所念已，即白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Knowing what the lord of Indra thought, Venerable Śāriputra said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有人聞此甚深般若波羅蜜多法門，發信解心尊重恭敬、受持讀誦，為人演說，
translation: “Furthermore, if there are those who hear this profound teaching of the perfection of wisdom and develop faith in it, revere it, venerate it, preserve it, recite it, and explain it to others.

source_sentence: 如所說學、如所說行、如理相應者，是人應如不退轉菩薩摩訶薩功德無異。
translation: If someone trains as they've been taught, practices as they've been taught, and principles associated with them, this person should be like the nonretrogressing bodhisattva Mahāsattva whose merit is no different.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 此甚深般若波羅蜜多法門，若人以少善根不能得聞。
translation: This is the profound prajñāpāramitā dharma-gate, which a person with few good roots can't hear.

source_sentence: 又若於先佛所不曾修習者，是故今時即不能生清淨信解。
translation: Also, if someone hadn't cultivated it before the Buddha, that's why they wouldn't be able to give rise to pure faith and understanding now.

source_sentence: 又復，世尊！
translation: Again, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有人聞此甚深般若波羅蜜多法門，生違背毀謗者，當知是人於先佛所曾聞是法，
translation: If there are people who hear this profound teaching of the perfection of wisdom and give rise to disobedience and disparagement, know that such people have heard this teaching from buddhas before.

source_sentence: 爾時已生違背毀謗。
translation: At that point, they've already produced dissent and disparagement.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 是人雖復以少善根先得聞此甚深般若波羅蜜多法門，而為懈怠所覆，不起精進，
translation: Even though they had previously heard this profound teaching of prajñāpāramitā with few roots of goodness, still they were hindered by laziness and did not make effort.

source_sentence: 無信無忍，於甚深法不生愛樂，由不樂故不能解了，以其不了又復不能請問諸佛及佛弟子。
translation: They lack faith and forbearance, don't give rise to affection or pleasure for the profound Dharma, can't understand it because of their unpleasantness, and because they don't understand it, they can't question the buddhas

source_sentence: 由是緣故，今聞此法起違謗者，當知往昔已生違謗。」
translation: Because of these reasons, those who now hear this teaching and give rise to disobedience should know that disobedience has already been given rise to in the past.

source_sentence: 爾時，帝釋天主白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Indra the lord of the gods said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若人敬禮般若波羅蜜多者，是即敬禮諸佛一切智智。」
translation: If someone venerates the prajñāpāramitā, this is to venerate all the buddhas' omniscience and cognition.

source_sentence: 佛告帝釋天主言：「如是，如是！
translation: The Buddha told Śakra Devānām-Indra, So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若人敬禮般若波羅蜜多，是即敬禮諸佛一切智智。
translation: If someone venerates the prajñāpāramitā, this is to venerate all the buddhas' omniscience and cognition.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 從一切智智生般若波羅蜜多，般若波羅蜜多復生一切智智。
translation: From omniscience and cognition, the prajñāpāramitā arises, and the prajñāpāramitā also arises from omniscience and cognition.

source_sentence: 諸菩薩摩訶薩行般若波羅蜜多時，當如是住般若波羅蜜多、如是習般若波羅蜜多。」
translation: When bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, they thus abide in the perfection of wisdom and thus cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 爾時，帝釋天主復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Indra the lord of the gods again said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩行般若波羅蜜多時，云何得名如是住、如是習？」
translation: When bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, how can they be called thus abiding and thus accumulating?

source_sentence: 佛讚帝釋天主言：「善哉，善哉！
translation: The Buddha praised Śakra Devānām-Indra, saying, Good, good!

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 汝今善問如來、應供、正等正覺此甚深義。
translation: Now, you should well ask the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Enlightened One about this profound meaning.

source_sentence: 然汝能問，皆是如來神力護念。
translation: But whatever questions you can ask, they're all guarded by the Tathāgata's supernormal powers and mindfulness.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩行般若波羅蜜多時，不住色不住色相。
translation: Suppose a bodhisattva-mahāsattva doesn't abide in form and doesn't abide in form when he practices the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 菩薩若不住色不住色相，是為習色。
translation: If a bodhisattva doesn't abide in form and doesn't abide in form and characteristics, this is called accumulating form.

source_sentence: 不住受、想、行、識不住識相。
translation: They don't abide in sensation, perception, volition, or consciousness and don't abide in the characteristics of consciousness.

source_sentence: 菩薩若不住識不住識相，是為習識。
translation: If a bodhisattva doesn't abide in consciousness and doesn't abide in the characteristics of consciousness, this is called accumulating consciousness.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 菩薩若不習色不習色相，是為不住色。
translation: If a bodhisattva doesn't cultivate form and doesn't cultivate form and characteristics, this is because he doesn't abide in form.

source_sentence: 若不習受、想、行、識不習識相，是為不住識。
translation: If someone doesn't cultivate sensation, perception, volition, and consciousness and doesn't cultivate the characteristics of consciousness, this is because they don't abide in consciousness.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩如是行般若波羅蜜多時，得名如是住、如是習。」
translation: When bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas thus practice the perfection of wisdom, they'll be called thus abiding and thus accumulating.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者舍利子白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Venerable Śāriputra said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜多最極甚深，般若波羅蜜多不能得其邊際源底，般若波羅蜜多廣大無量。」
translation: The prajñāpāramitā is the most profound, and the prajñāpāramitā can't obtain its limitless source, and the prajñāpāramitā is vast and immeasurable.

source_sentence: 佛言：「舍利子！
translation: The Buddha said, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 如是，如是！
translation: So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩行般若波羅蜜多時，不住色甚深，不住色相甚深。
translation: Suppose a bodhisattva Mahāsattva doesn't abide in the depth of form when he practices the perfection of wisdom and doesn't abide in the depth of form.

source_sentence: 菩薩若不住色甚深，不住色相甚深，是為習色甚深。
translation: If a bodhisattva doesn't abide in the profoundness of form and doesn't abide in the profoundness of form and characteristics, this is the profoundness of accumulating form.

source_sentence: 不住受想行識甚深，不住識相甚深。
translation: They don't abide in the profundity of feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness, and they don't abide in the profundity of the characteristics of consciousness.

source_sentence: 菩薩若不住識甚深，不住識相甚深，是為習識甚深。
translation: If a bodhisattva doesn't abide in the profundity of consciousness and doesn't abide in the profundity of the characteristics of consciousness, this is called the profundity of accumulating consciousness.

source_sentence: 舍利子！
translation: “O Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 菩薩若不習色甚深，不習色相甚深，是為不住色甚深。
translation: If a bodhisattva doesn't cultivate the profundity of form and doesn't cultivate the profundity of form and characteristics, this is because he doesn't abide in the profundity of form.

source_sentence: 若不習受想行識甚深，不習識相甚深，是為不住識甚深。」

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者舍利子白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Venerable Śāriputra said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此甚深般若波羅蜜多法門，應為住不退轉已得授記諸菩薩摩訶薩如理宣說。
translation: This profound prajñāpāramitā dharma-gate of the Dharma should be explained correctly by bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and bodhisattvas who abide in nonretrogression and have been given assurance.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 彼諸菩薩若聞所說，不疑不悔離諸障礙。」
translation: If those bodhisattvas hear what they teach, they won't doubt or regret it and part with the hindrances.

source_sentence: 帝釋天主即白尊者舍利子言：「如尊者所說，其事如是。
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra then said to Venerable Śāriputra, As the venerable one explains, it's like this.

source_sentence: 設復為彼未得授記菩薩說者，當有何咎？」
translation: What's the blame if someone were to explain it for another bodhisattva who hasn't yet received a prediction?

source_sentence: 尊者舍利子言：「憍尸迦！
translation: Venerable Śāriputra said, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若為未授記菩薩說者而亦無咎。
translation: If someone speaks for a bodhisattva who hasn't yet given assurance, there's no blame.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 彼菩薩雖未授記，若得聞此般若波羅蜜多法門，隨喜信受瞻禮恭敬，不驚不怖不退不沒，

translation: You should know that this bodhisattva has long abided in the great vehicle teaching to ripen good roots, and soon he'll give an assurance of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment to one or two or three tathāgatas

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！

source_sentence: 彼菩薩雖於現在佛世尊所未得授記，未來世中決定得見諸佛如來、應供、正等正覺，
translation: “Although those bodhisattvas had not yet received their predictions from the present buddhas and world-honored ones, in the future they will surely be able to see all buddha-tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened

source_sentence: 瞻禮供養，得授阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記，修諸善法，乃至證得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果。」
translation: They venerate and make offerings, receive assurance of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment, cultivate good qualities, and attain the fruit of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者舍利子白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Venerable Śāriputra said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若菩薩暫得聞此般若波羅蜜多法門瞻禮信受者，尚說此菩薩久已安住大乘法中成熟善根，
translation: If a bodhisattva can momentarily hear this teaching of prajñā-pāramitā and venerate and believe it, he's still saying that this bodhisattva has long been abiding in the great vehicle teaching to ripen good roots.

source_sentence: 何況有能於此法門讀誦思惟，為人演說，如理修行者，其事云何？」
translation: How could there be someone who can recite and contemplate this teaching, explain it for others, and correctly cultivate it?

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告尊者舍利子言：「如是，如是！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Venerable Śāriputra, saying, So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 如汝所說。
translation: It's as you say.

source_sentence: 若菩薩暫得聞此般若波羅蜜多法門瞻禮信受者，我說是菩薩久已安住大乘法中成熟善根，
translation: If a bodhisattva can momentarily hear this teaching of prajñā-pāramitā and venerate and believe it, I'll say that this is a bodhisattva who has long abided in the great vehicle teaching to ripen good roots

source_sentence: 況復有能於此法中讀誦思惟，為人演說，如理修行者，決定速能成就阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果。」
translation: How could there be someone who can read, recite, contemplate, and explain this teaching to others and correctly cultivate it? They'll surely quickly attain the fruit of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者舍利子白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Venerable Śāriputra said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今樂說譬喻以明其義。」
translation: Now, I'll happily explain an analogy to clarify its meaning.

source_sentence: 佛言：「舍利子！
translation: The Buddha said, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 隨汝意說。」
translation: I'll explain it as you wish.

source_sentence: 舍利子言：「世尊！
translation: Śāriputra said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 譬如有住菩薩乘者勤求菩提，或時夢已處菩提座。
translation: It's like someone who abides in the bodhisattva vehicle and diligently seeks enlightenment, or they might be on the seat of enlightenment after a dream.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼菩薩得是夢已，當知漸近阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果。
translation: After that bodhisattva attains this dream, you should know that he's gradually approaching the fruit of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 諸求菩提者亦復如是。
translation: So it is with those who seek enlightenment.

source_sentence: 若得聞此般若波羅蜜多法門隨喜信受，當知是人久已安住大乘法中成熟善根，
translation: If someone hears this teaching of prajñāpāramitā and follows it with joy and faith, you should know that they've long since settled in the great vehicle teaching to ripen their good roots.

source_sentence: 決定當得授菩提記。
translation: They'll surely attain the assurance of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 何況有能讀誦思惟，為人演說，如理修行者，當知是人決定速證阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果。
translation: How could there be someone who recites, contemplates, explains, and correctly cultivates it for others? You should know that such a person will surely quickly realize the fruit of highest, complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 有諸眾生以業障故背如實智，是故遠離此般若波羅蜜多法門，不能發生清淨信解，
translation: Because there are sentient beings who turn their backs on knowledge as it really is because of the karmic hindrances, therefore they're far removed from this teaching of prajñā-pāramitā and can't develop pure faith and understanding.

source_sentence: 由是不能成熟善根。
translation: As a result, they can't ripen the good roots.

source_sentence: 有諸眾生久於此法，聽受信解，安住實際，成熟善根。
translation: If there are sentient beings who have long listened to this teaching, accepted it with faith, abide in its reality, and mature their good roots.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 當知是人住如實際不復退轉，漸近阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果。
translation: You should know that this person abides as it really is, doesn't regress again, and gradually approaches the fruit of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 又如有人欲過百由旬乃至五百由旬曠野險路，於其路中若進若退怖畏疑惑。
translation: Again, suppose someone wants to go beyond a hundred yojanas up to five hundred yojanas on a dangerous path in the wilderness, and they're frightened and doubtful whether they're going or retreating on that path.

source_sentence: 是人漸行欲出險路，忽見有諸守牛羊人，即知此去城邑不遠。
translation: As the man was gradually on his way out of the dangerous path, he suddenly saw some guarding cattle and sheep herders. He knew that they were not far from the city.

source_sentence: 是人即時心得安隱，無復起諸盜賊等怖。
translation: That person immediately attains peace of mind and no longer has the fear of thieves or thieves.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 是人得見守牛羊者，即知漸近城邑聚落。
translation: When that person sees a herding cow or sheep, he knows they're gradually approaching cities and villages.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 求菩提者亦復如是，若得聞此般若波羅蜜多法門，當知漸近阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果，
translation: Those seeking enlightenment are likewise, and if they hear this teaching of the perfection of wisdom, they should know that they're gradually approaching the fruit of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 不久得授大菩提記，不復墮於聲聞、緣覺之地。
translation: Soon, he'll be granted the assurance of great enlightenment and no longer fall into the stages of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 得聞般若波羅蜜多法門瞻禮信受為前相故。
translation: It's because hearing the prajñāpāramitā dharma-gate and venerating and believing in it are the prior characteristics.

source_sentence: 是故諸菩薩摩訶薩，應當於此般若波羅蜜多法門，尊重恭敬如理修行。」
translation: Therefore, bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, should venerate and respect this prajñāpāramitā dharma-gate of wisdom and cultivate it accordingly.

source_sentence: 佛說佛母出生三法藏般若波羅蜜多經卷第九
translation: Foshuo fomu give birth to the three collections of teachings, prajñāpāramitā-sūtra, vol. 9
